# Web Scraping {#sec-scraping}

![](images/scraping1.png)

```{r}
library(rvest)

html <- read_html("https://rimonim.github.io/blog.html")
```

![](images/scraping2.png)

```{r}
post_titles <- html |> 
  html_elements("h3.no-anchor.listing-title") |> 
  html_text2()

head(post_titles)
```

```{r}
posts <- tibble(
  date = html |> 
    html_elements("div.listing-date") |> 
    html_text2(),
  title = post_titles
)

head(posts)
```

See [the relevant chapter in R for Data Science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/webscraping) for a more in-depth tutorial on webs scraping.

use the [polite](https://dmi3kno.github.io/polite/) package by Dmytro Perepolkin
